content: how do i unzip file
unzip file.zip
how do i ensure that rows in tsv file are sorted alphabetically
sort file.tsv
how do i check if rows in tsv file are sorted alphabetically
sort file.tsv | diff file.tsv -
how do i sort file based on a column
sort -k [column_number] file.txt
how do i convert string to num in tsv file and then sort converted numbers
awk '{print $1, $2+0}' file.tsv | sort -k2n
how do i convert string to num
awk '{print $1, $2+0}' file.txt
how do i convert string to num in 2nd column in tsv file
awk '{print $1, $2+0, $3}' file.tsv
encrypt targets.txt file using openssl and set key to geronimo saving encrypted file as targets.enc
openssl enc -aes-256-cbc -salt -in targets.txt -out targets.enc -pass pass:geronimo
delete all files but targets.enc
rm !(targets.enc)
delete all files but targets.enc in this dir
rm !(targets.enc)
i got this when trying zsh: number expected
This error usually occurs when you try to perform arithmetic operations on non-numeric values. Please check your command and ensure that you are performing arithmetic operations on numeric values.
how do i connect to local server in directory /home/john
ssh john@localhost
connect to localhost port 2222
ssh -p 2222 john@localhost
download files from localhost server

To download files from a localhost server, you can use the `scp` command. Here's an example command to download a file named `file.txt` from the `john` user's home directory on the localhost server to your current directory:

```
scp john@localhost:/home/john/file.txt .
```

This will download the file to your current directory.
get all files starting with lettter a

To get all files starting with the letter "a" in the current directory, you can use the following command:

```
ls a*
```

This will list all files in the current directory that start with the letter "a".
how do i set the port

To set a port for a specific command, you can use the `-p` option followed by the port number. For example, to start a web server on port 8080, you can use the following command:

```
python -m http.server 8080
```

This will start a web server on port 8080. You can replace `python -m http.server` with the command you want to run, and replace `8080` with the port number you want to use.
how do i set the port when downloading files from localhost server

To download files from a localhost server using a specific port, you can use the `-P` option followed by the port number with the `scp` command. Here's an example command to download a file named `file.txt` from the `john` user's home directory on the localhost server using port 2222 to your current directory:

```
scp -P 2222 john@localhost:/home/john/file.txt .
```

This will download the file to your current directory using port 2222.
set wow.sh permission to 755
chmod 755 "wow.sh"
copy wow.sh to localhost server

To copy the `wow.sh` file to a localhost server, you can use the `scp` command. Here's an example command to copy the `wow.sh` file to the `john` user's home directory on the localhost server:

```
scp wow.sh john@localhost:/home/john/
```

This will copy the `wow.sh` file to the `john` user's home directory on the localhost server.
run wow.sh

To run the `wow.sh` script, you can use the following command:

```
./wow.sh
```

Make sure you are in the same directory as the `wow.sh` file before running this command. If the script is not executable, you may need to run `chmod +x wow.sh` first to make it executable.
